message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $18,000. This is a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a competitive price.
Thanks for the offer, Alice, but $18,000 is too high for me. I'm willing to pay $12,000 for the product. This is a fair price that reflects the value I see in it.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $18,000 is a bit steep, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm now willing to sell the product to you for $15,500. This is a reasonable compromise that still reflects the product's value.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $15,500 is still too high.  I'm firm on my offer of $12,000.  This is a fair price considering the value I see in the product, and it allows us both to come to an agreement.

I understand that you're firm on your offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $12,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, and I'm now willing to sell the product to you for $14,000. This is a fair compromise that still reflects the product's value.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $14,000 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go up to $13,000 for the product. This is a fair offer that allows us to both get a good deal. Let's try to make this happen.

I understand that you're getting closer to my minimum price, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $13,000. I'm willing to make one more compromise, and I'm now willing to sell the product to you for $13,500. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However,  $13,500 is still above my budget. I'm going to stick with my offer of $13,000. If you're not willing to accept that, I'll have to go with another seller.
